intro: Chrysanthemum oreades, commonly known as the alpine chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. Chrysanthemum oreades is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
